etymology.description: 行(行) (xíng, 'go') + phonetic: 朮(朮) (shù, 'millet plant') = movement/execution + phonetic cue -> skills or techniques in executing tasks
etymology.interpretation: 術(術) (shù, 'technique') combines the semantics of 行(行) (xíng, 'go') representing action or movement, with the phonetic component 朮(朮) (shù, 'millet plant'), which guides pronunciation. This combination conveys the idea of implementing processes, creating a word for skill or art in performing tasks.
etymology.simplification: 术 is a simplified form where 行(行) (xíng) and 朮(朮) (shù) are condensed to retain essential elements of the original character while reducing complexity.

examples.chinese: 他的绘画术独具匠心(他的繪畫術獨具匠心)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de huìhuà shù dú jù jiàngxīn.
examples.english: His painting technique is uniquely ingenious.

examples.chinese: 现代医学依靠先进的治疗术(現代醫學依靠先進的治療術)，挽救了无数生命(挽救了無數生命)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàndài yīxué yīkào xiānjìn de zhìliáo shù, wǎnjiùle wúshù shēngmìng.
examples.english: Modern medicine relies on advanced treatment methods to save countless lives.

examples.chinese: 她不断钻研烹饪术(她不斷鑽研烹飪術)。
examples.english: She continuously studies the art of cooking.
